name: presumably

B2 used to say what you think is the likely situation: They can presumably afford to buy a bigger apartment. Presumably he just forgot to send the letter.
More examplesFewer examplesPresumably they've decided to move back to Australia.Presumably they can't afford a new car, or they'd have bought one by now.You're going to go with her, presumably?Her mother will presumably stay with them until she's made a full recovery.You've bought all the materials you need, presumably?
